snippet: In the midst of the federal shutdown, members of Congress managed to rescue an important program that extends visas to Iraqi translators.
abstract: Editorial praises Congress for setting aside bitter shutdown dispute in order to salvage important program that extends visas to Iraqi translators who risked their lives to assist American troops during the Iraq war and now face retribution; warns bill is only a compromised, short-term solution that does not address existing visa backlog.
lead_paragraph: In the midst of the federal shutdown, members of Congress managed to rescue an important program that extends visas to Iraqi translators.
